channel.title: Location specific on Climate Tools
channel.description: Recent content in Location specific on Climate Tools

item.title: AdaptVA Interactive Map
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: This tool from AdaptVA uses an interactive map to display sea level rise projections and FEMA flood hazard zones, as well as social vulnerability, infrastructure, and natural capital in a single viewer.

item.title: Bay Footprint Calculator
item.description: Developed By: CBF, and UVA Summary: The Bay Footprint Calculator is an easy-to-use tool that estimates your contribution to nitrogen pollution in the Chesapeake Bay.

item.title: Beach Nourishment Viewer
item.description: Developed By: Western Carolina University_Program for the Study of Developed Shorelines

item.title: Case Study and Information Exchange
item.description: Developed By: EPA Summary: Part of the Creating Resilient Water Utilities Tool (CRWU), the Case Study and Information Exchange provides examples from water utilities that have implemented adaptation measures for natural hazards and water management challenges such as climate change.

item.title: Chesapeake Bay Interpretive Buoy System (CBIBS)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA Summary: The Chesapeake Bay Interpretive Buoys System (CBIBS) is a network of ocean observing platforms that provide real-time access to meteorological, oceanographic and water quality data throughout the Chesapeake Bay.

item.title: Chesapeake Bay Operational Forecast System (CBOFS)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA Summary: The Chesapeake Bay Operational Forecast System (CBOFS) tool is a data viewer that provides real time forecasts of oceanographic conditions in the Chesapeake Bay.

item.title: Climate Smart Farming (CSF) Growing Degree Day Calculator
item.description: Developed By: Cornell University_College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Summary: Part of the Climate Smart Farming toolkit, the Growing Degree Day Calculator calculates and plots observed and predicted growing degree days for a given location during a growing season.

item.title: Climate Smart Farming (CSF) Water Deficit Calculator
item.description: Developed By: Cornell University_College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Summary: Part of the Climate Smart Farming toolkit, the Water Deficit Calculator estimates soil water content within a crop’s effective root zone to predict potential water deficits and associated plant stress.

item.title: Climate Smart Farming (CSF) Winter Cover Crop Planting Scheduler
item.description: Developed By: Cornell University_College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Summary: Part of the Climate Smart Farming toolkit, the Winter Cover Crop Planting Scheduler calculates the probability that specific cover crops reach important levels of growth by the end of the growing season.

item.title: CSF Apple Stage / Freeze Damage Probability
item.description: Developed By: Cornell University_College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Summary: Part of the Climate Smart Farming toolkit, the Apple Stage/Freeze Probability Tool predicts the potential freeze damage for 3 varieties of apple crops.

item.title: Delaware Air Quality Forecast
item.description: Developed By: DDNREC Summary: The Delaware Air Quality Forecast is a user-friendly forecast that provides daily air quality forecasts for the state of Delaware.

item.title: Delaware Bay Operational Forecast System (DBOFS)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA, and Rutgers University_Regional Ocean Modeling System Summary: The Delaware Bay Operational Forecast System (DBOFS) tool is a data viewer that provides real time forecasts of oceanographic conditions in the Delaware Bay.

item.title: Delaware Climate Projections Portal
item.description: Developed By: DDNREC_Division of Energy & Climate Summary: The Delaware Climate Change Projections Portal allows users to easily find and download downscaled climate projection data for the state of Delaware.

item.title: Delaware Environmental Monitoring Sites
item.description: Developed By: DEMAC, Delaware Geological Survey, and University of Delaware

item.title: Drought Management Database
item.description: Developed By: NDMC Summary: The Drought Management Database is a growing collection of strategies to manage and prepare for drought impacts in the United States.

item.title: Drought Risk Atlas
item.description: Developed By: NDMC, NOAA_NWS, and NOAA_RCC Summary: The Drought Risk Atlas provides historical drought information for weather stations across the United States through an interactive map viewer and data portal.

item.title: Drought-Applied Climate Information System (ACIS)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA_RCC Summary: The Applied Climate Information System (ACIS) Drought Portal allows users to view past and current temperature and precipitation data from weather stations throughout the US.

item.title: Eyes On The Bay: Main site
item.description: Developed By: MDNR Summary: Eyes On The Bay provides maps, data and information about tidal water quality conditions and impacts in the state of Maryland.

item.title: FloodFactor
item.description: Developed By: First Street Foundation Summary: FloodiQ is a flood risk mapping tool that shows the extent of potential inundation from tidal flooding and hurricane storm surge on the East and Gulf coasts of the U.

item.title: Grape Hardiness & Freeze Risk
item.description: Developed By: Cornell University_College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Summary: Part of the Climate Smart Farming toolkit, the Grape Freeze Risk Tool predicts the potential freeze damage for 3 varieties of grapes.

item.title: Hampton Roads Geospatial Exchange Online (HRGEO)
item.description: Developed By: HRPDC, HRSD, and HRTPO Summary: HRGEO is a data portal that allows to users to view and download geographic, cultural, and population data in Hampton Roads, VA.

item.title: i-Tree Design
item.description: Developed By: USFS, Davey Tree Expert Company, Arbor Day Foundation, Society of Municipal Arborists, International Society of Arboriculture, Casey Trees, and SUNY_College of Environmental Science and Forestry.

item.title: i-Tree Hydro, and Eco
item.description: Developed By: USFS, Davey Tree Expert Company, Arbor Day Foundation, Society of Municipal Arborists, International Society of Arboriculture, Casey Trees, and SUNY_College of Environmental Science and Forestry.

item.title: i-Tree Mytree and Landscape
item.description: Developed By: USFS, Davey Tree Expert Company, Arbor Day Foundation, Society of Municipal Arborists, International Society of Arboriculture, Casey Trees, and SUNY_College of Environmental Science and Forestry.

item.title: Know Your Zone
item.description: Developed By: VDEM Summary: The Know Your Zone tool is an interactive mapping tool that allows residents of coastal Virginia to determine their evacuation zone for hurricanes and severe storms.

item.title: MARISA Climate Data Portal: Interactive Map for the MARISA Region
item.description: Developed By: NOAA, and MARISA Summary: The Interactive Map for the MARISA region is an interactive web map that enables users to view real time climate data for the MARISA region.

item.title: MARISA Climate Impacts Summary and Outlook Reports
item.description: Developed By: MARISA Summary: The MARISA Climate Impacts Summary and Outlook Reports are a quarterly series summarizing seasonal weather and climate trends and forecasts for the Chesapeake Bay Watershed.

item.title: Maryland Coastal Atlas
item.description: Developed By: MDNR Summary: The Maryland Coastal Atlas is a mapping tool that allows users query, map, and analyze spatial data to better understand Maryland’s coastal and marine resources.

item.title: My Environment
item.description: Developed By: EPA Summary: The EPA’s MyEnvironment tool is an online dashboard that provides access to a cross-section environmental information specific to a user’s location.

item.title: National Beach Nourishment Database
item.description: Developed By: American Shore & Beach Protection Agency, Regional Sediment Management Program, and APTIM

item.title: Operational Forecast System
item.description: Developed By: NOAA Summary: Tool including the Chesapeake Bay Forecast System and Delaware Bay Forecast System

item.title: OSPREY Public
item.description: Developed By: NOAA_NWS Summary: Operation and Situational Preparedness for Responding to an Emergency (OSPREY) is an interactive map for Maryland that presents users with statewide current conditions on weather, traffic, and electrical outages.

item.title: Percent Light at Leaf Calculator
item.description: Developed By: CBP Summary: The Percent Light at Leaf (PLL) calculator can be used to estimate the percentage of light penetrating the water column and reaching submerged aquatic vegetation (SAV) leaf surface at a given depth.

item.title: PINEMAP
item.description: Developed By: North Carolina State Climate Office, and USDA Summary: PINEMAP is a suite of 13 products focusing on loblolly pines in the Southeastern US across four categories: Environment, Establishment, Management, and Production.

item.title: Potomac Inundation Maps
item.description: Developed By: DC Silver Jackets, NOAA_NWS, USACE, USGS, City of Alexandria, and DCDOEE

item.title: Sea Level Report Cards
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: The Sea-Level Report cards provide interactive graphs and narrative descriptions of sea-level trends and projections for 32 coastal locations across the U.

item.title: Shoreline Assessment Mapper
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: The Shoreline Assessment Mapper is an interactive map that displays a variety of shoreline data for the coastal zone of Virginia.

item.title: Shoreline Management Self-Guided Decision Tools
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: The CCRM Shoreline Management Self-Guided Decision Tools guide users through a series of questions about shoreline conditions to provide a shoreline best management practice recommendation.

item.title: Submerged Aquatic Vegetation (SAV) in the Chesapeake Bay
item.description: Developed By: VIMS Summary: The Submerged Aquatic Vegetation (SAV) in Chesapeake Bay tool provides access to recent and historical SAV monitoring data from the Virginia Institute of Marine Science SAV program.

item.title: USGS Exploration and Graphics for RivEr Trends (EGRET)
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: The Exploration and Graphics RivEr Trends (EGRET) is an R package for the analysis of hydrologic data concerning long-term changes in rivers, river flows, and river quality.

item.title: USGS National Water Census Data Portal: Streamflow
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: The USGS National Water Census Data Portal Streamflow tool allows users to address streamflow averages for a specific locality, if a nearby stream gage is available.

item.title: USGS Water Data for the Nation
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: The USGS Water Data for the Nation is a data portal that allows users to view real time data from approximately 1.

item.title: Virginia Coastal Geospatial and Educational Mapping System (GEMS)
item.description: Developed By: VDEQ Summary: The Virginia Coastal Geospatial and Educational Mapping System (Coastal GEMS) is an interactive map and inventory of coastal resource data and conservation planning tools for Virginiaâ€™s coastal zone.

item.title: Virginia Estuarine and Coastal Observing System (VECOS)
item.description: Developed By: VIMS Summary: The Virginia Estuarine and Coastal Observing System (VECOS) provides access to water quality and meteorological data from a variety of monitoring programs conducted by the Chesapeake Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve (CBNERR) in Virginia.

item.title: Virginia Flood Risk Information System (VFRIS)
item.description: Developed By: VIMS, CCRM, and VDCR Summary: The Virginia Flood Risk Information System uses an interactive map to display FEMA flood risk zones in Virginia.
